definition: A measure of the number of occurrences of a repeating event per unit of time, commonly used in the context of waves, signals, or oscillations. It is often utilized to describe the rate at which a particular event or phenomenon repeats within a given timeframe.

examples.german: Die Frequenz des Radiosenders betr√§gt 98.5 MHz.
examples.english: The frequency of the radio station is 98.5 MHz.

examples.german: Die Frequenz des WLAN-Netzwerks ist stabil.
examples.english: The frequency of the Wi-Fi network is stable.

examples.german: Die Frequenz des Herzschlags kann gemessen werden.
examples.english: The frequency of the heartbeat can be measured.

examples.german: Die Frequenz der Schallwellen beeinflusst den Klang.
examples.english: The frequency of the sound waves affects the tone.

examples.german: Die Frequenz der Lichtwellen bestimmt die Farbe.
examples.english: The frequency of the light waves determines the color.
